I resolved the problem by patching my "junit.jar".
I've added the classes used by jasperreport in 
the "excluded.properties" in the jar.
More info on http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_8

Thanks for the reaction.
Bart

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> 
wrote:
> bartvdcammen wrote:
> 
> > My test runs with textui.Testrunner but with the gui Testrunners I
> > get the following errors:
> >     java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
> >           at dori.jasper.engine.JasperFillManager.fillReport
> > (JasperFillManager.java:204)
> >         Caused by:
> > org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException:
> > org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException: Class
> > org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger does not implement Log
> >         Caused by:
> > org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException: Class
> > org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger does not implement Log
> > 
> > What could cause this problem ? I guess it's a logging conflict.
> > How could I fix this?
> 
> Are you running JDK 1.4? At a minimum, try running your tests with 
the 
> <junit> fork attribute set to "true".
> 
> > In the building proces we use the junit task of ant who seems to 
use
> > a gui TestRunner (it gives the same errors), so switching to 
textui
> > is not an option.
> 
> The <junit> Ant task does not require the GUI test runner. In fact, 
it 
> uses a text runner by default, so you must be doing something 
special in 
> your buildfile.
> -- 
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
